result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian S Klibowitz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs shall be paid at the rate of $25 per month commencing May 15, 2015 and by the 15th of each month thereafter until paid in full or judgment shall enter for nonpayment.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.
Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian S Klibowitz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).
Sent copy via email of JOC, Complaint & Plea Questionnaire to Wis Dept of Justice CIB per request recd 8-18-15
Victim does not request to be present for hearings

Def appeared in person.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Def waives right to counsel, Court accepts waiver;    Guilty plea entered.  Colloquy w/ Def; Court accepts plea and finds def guilty; Statement from State, Def; Court imposes a fine of $579.00 to be paid at a rate of $25 per month commencing 5-15-15  or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.     Defendant shall, within three (3) days, contact the Washington County Sheriff's Department for purposes of supplying a biological specimen for DNA analysis.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson for State.  Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Pretrial held; Def waives right to counsel, Court accepts waiver.  Resolution reached.
Initial appearance on April 6, 2015 at 09:45 am.
Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #106673 on 12/7/14; COC Rec# 14R 024357 dated 12/8/14
